alert.note: Alert for Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 3:50AM MST until February 22 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A WINTER STORM ARRIVES THIS AFTERNOON INTO WEDNESDAY IMPACTING NORTHERN COLORADO... .A system will bring heavy snowfall across the Front Range starting in the higher elevations later this afternoon. Snow begins in the foothills and northern I-25 corridor starting late tonight. The heaviest snowfall will occur in Park Range and the Larimer county foothills. This will likely lead to periods of poor visibility and difficult travel conditions especially in the Colorado high country. Also look for slow travel for the morning and afternoon commutes on Wednesday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 8 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 10 inches. * WHERE...The Southern Front Range Foothills. * WHEN...From 2 AM to 8 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.

area.areaDesc: Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet
